title: Running secure enterprise workloads
introduction: Use IBM Cloud enterprises and a variety of tools and products to securely develop, deploy, and manage your regulated, mission-critical enterprise workloads in the cloud.

section_recommended.title: Setting up an enterprise
section_recommended.description: Learn how to create an enterprise, add accounts and organize them in account groups, invite users, and explore subscriptions.

section_recommended.title: Using projects for IaC deployments
section_recommended.description: Learn how to manage resources and Infrastructure as Code (IaC) deployments with projects, which enable teams to configure, deploy, and monitor deployments by using DevOps best practices.

section_recommended.title: Use DevSecOps to set up a secure software supply chain
section_recommended.description: Leverage DevSecOps toolchains to automate the integration of security at every phase of the software development lifecycle.

section_recommended.title: Ensure continuous compliance and stay audit-ready
section_recommended.description: Leverage IBM Cloud tools to ensure the workloads deployed in your enterprise always meet your regulatory and compliance standards.

section_recommended.title: Customize and extend IBM Cloud deployable architectures
section_recommended.description: Start with an IBM Cloud deployable architecture and customize it to meet your needs.

section_recommended.title: Onboard approved software and deployable architectures to private catalogs
section_recommended.description: You can customize what products are available from the catalog for users in your enterprise to ensure that only approved architectures that adhere to your compliance standards are deployed.

section_videos.title: Security and compliance for regulated workloads on IBM Cloud

tiles.title: Organize existing resources in your project
tiles.description: Now, you can use a project to organize resources across accounts. By doing so, your resources remain deployed in their respective accounts, but you gain an at-a-glance view of those resources in your project. Organizing resources is experimental and might change without notice.

tiles.title: Automatically detect drift in your project
tiles.description: You can now run daily drift detection scans to identify and override (or adopt) the detected changes. Automatic drift detection is an experimental feature for evaluation or testing purposes.

tiles.title: Add references in your project
tiles.description: It's now easier to link architectures to one another by adding references to inputs or outputs. Add the reference as an input in an architecture that you're configuring, and the value is automatically used for deployment.
